001package com.telos.loops.transport;
002
003import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
004
005/**
006 * Interface for HTTP transport implementations in the Loops SDK.
007 *
008 * <p>This interface abstracts the HTTP client layer, allowing different HTTP client
009 * implementations to be used with the SDK. The default implementation uses OkHttp via {@link
010 * OkHttpTransport}.
011 *
012 * <h2>Default Implementation</h2>
013 *
014 * <p>The SDK uses {@link OkHttpTransport} by default, which provides:
015 *
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li>HTTP/2 support
018 *   <li>Connection pooling
019 *   <li>Automatic retry for failed connections
020 *   <li>Efficient resource usage
021 * </ul>
022 *
023 * <h2>Custom Implementations</h2>
024 *
025 * <p>You can implement this interface to use a different HTTP client or add custom behavior like
026 * logging, metrics collection, or request/response modification.
027 *
028 * <h3>Example: Custom Transport with Logging</h3>
029 *
030 * <pre>{@code
031 * public class LoggingTransport implements Transport {
032 *     private final Transport delegate;
033 *     private final Logger logger;
034 *
035 *     public LoggingTransport(Transport delegate, Logger logger) {
036 *         this.delegate = delegate;
037 *         this.logger = logger;
038 *     }
039 *
040 *     @Override
041 *     public TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request) {
042 *         logger.info("Request: {} {}", request.httpMethod(), request.url());
043 *         long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
044 *
045 *         try {
046 *             TransportResponse response = delegate.execute(request);
047 *             long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - start;
048 *             logger.info("Response: {} ({}ms)", response.statusCode(), duration);
049 *             return response;
050 *         } catch (Exception e) {
051 *             logger.error("Request failed", e);
052 *             throw e;
053 *         }
054 *     }
055 *
056 *     @Override
057 *     public CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request) {
058 *         logger.info("Async request: {} {}", request.httpMethod(), request.url());
059 *         long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
060 *
061 *         return delegate.executeAsync(request)
062 *             .whenComplete((response, error) -> {
063 *                 long duration = System.currentTimeMillis() - start;
064 *                 if (error != null) {
065 *                     logger.error("Async request failed ({}ms)", duration, error);
066 *                 } else {
067 *                     logger.info("Async response: {} ({}ms)",
068 *                         response.statusCode(), duration);
069 *                 }
070 *             });
071 *     }
072 * }
073 * }</pre>
074 *
075 * <h3>Example: Custom Transport with Proxy</h3>
076 *
077 * <pre>{@code
078 * public class ProxyTransport implements Transport {
079 *     private final OkHttpClient client;
080 *
081 *     public ProxyTransport(String proxyHost, int proxyPort) {
082 *         Proxy proxy = new Proxy(Proxy.Type.HTTP,
083 *             new InetSocketAddress(proxyHost, proxyPort));
084 *         this.client = new OkHttpClient.Builder()
085 *             .proxy(proxy)
086 *             .build();
087 *     }
088 *
089 *     @Override
090 *     public TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request) {
091 *         OkHttpTransport transport = new OkHttpTransport(client);
092 *         return transport.execute(request);
093 *     }
094 *
095 *     @Override
096 *     public CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request) {
097 *         OkHttpTransport transport = new OkHttpTransport(client);
098 *         return transport.executeAsync(request);
099 *     }
100 * }
101 * }</pre>
102 *
103 * <h2>Implementation Requirements</h2>
104 *
105 * <p>When implementing this interface, ensure that:
106 *
107 * <ul>
108 *   <li>Both {@link #execute} and {@link #executeAsync} methods handle all HTTP methods (GET,
109 *       POST, PUT, DELETE)
110 *   <li>Request headers from {@link TransportRequest#headers()} are properly set
111 *   <li>Request body from {@link TransportRequest#body()} is sent when present
112 *   <li>Response headers are captured in {@link TransportResponse#headers()}
113 *   <li>Response body bytes are captured in {@link TransportResponse#response()}
114 *   <li>HTTP status code is returned in {@link TransportResponse#status()}
115 *   <li>Network failures throw appropriate exceptions
116 *   <li>Thread safety is maintained for concurrent requests
117 * </ul>
118 *
119 * <p><b>Note:</b> Currently, the SDK does not expose a way to inject custom transports via the
120 * public API. This is planned for a future release.
121 *
122 * @see OkHttpTransport
123 * @see TransportRequest
124 * @see TransportResponse
125 */
126public interface Transport {
127  /**
128   * Executes an HTTP request synchronously.
129   *
130   * <p>This method blocks until the HTTP request completes and a response is received.
131   *
132   * @param request the HTTP request to execute
133   * @return the HTTP response
134   * @throws RuntimeException if the request fails due to network error, timeout, or other issues
135   */
136  TransportResponse execute(TransportRequest request);
137
138  /**
139   * Executes an HTTP request asynchronously.
140   *
141   * <p>This method returns immediately with a {@link CompletableFuture} that will be completed
142   * when the HTTP request finishes.
143   *
144   * @param request the HTTP request to execute
145   * @return a CompletableFuture that will complete with the HTTP response
146   */
147  CompletableFuture<TransportResponse> executeAsync(TransportRequest request);
148}
